snippet: The restrictive agreement between the government and the family of the unknowing HeLa cells donor was welcome and long overdue.
abstract: Editorial welcomes National Institutes of Health announcement about agreement with the family of Henrietta Lacks that will restrict NIH-financed research on the genome of cells taken from Lacks's tumor; cautions that the agreement should not set a precedent that would allow descendants of someone who voluntarily and knowingly donates tissues for research to restrict how they can be used.
lead_paragraph: The restrictive agreement between the government and the family of the unknowing HeLa cells donor was welcome and long overdue.

headline.main: Another Twist in the Saga of Henrietta Lacks
headline.print_headline: Another Twist in the Saga of Henrietta Lacks
